intro: Royena hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy royena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
